entries: Your voice becomes an alluring and commanding presence. You gain the ability to cast the {@spell Suggestion} spell without any material components. You can use this ability once per long rest at 3rd level, twice per long rest at 6th level, and 3 times per long rest at 9th level.

While the spell is active, if you spend at least 1 minute observing or interacting with the target outside combat, you can learn certain information about its capabilities compared to your own. The DM tells you if the creature is your equal, superior, or inferior in regard to two of the following characteristics of your choice:

items: Constitution score
Intelligence score
Wisdom score
Charisma score
Class levels (if any)

entries: At the DM's option, you might also realize you know a piece of the creature's history or one of its personality traits, if it has any.

subclassFeature.name: The Closer You Look
entries: You have advantage on attempts to pickpocket and make attack rolls and against creatures that have made attack rolls against you or targetted you with single target spells/effects within the last turn.

subclassFeature.name: Grand Spectacle
entries: You have an eye for the flashiest items in the room and know how to use them to create a massive spectacle. As an action, you can quickly use "invisible" strings to pull up to three objects you have touched with your hands in the last minute so long as they remained within 30 feet of you since you've touched them. These objects become extremely distracting for up to 5 minutes. Creatures within 20 feet of one of these objects must make a wisdom saving throw against your Exploit Save DC or be {@condition blinded} for up to 5 minutes or until your spectacle ends. During your spectacle, you can move any of these objects to another location within 30 feet of you. The spectacle ends when you choose to stop maneuvering the objects or until your concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell).
You can use this ability once per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Thief
entries: You hone your skills in the larcenous arts. Burglars, bandits, cutpurses, and other criminals typically follow this archetype—but so do treasure seekers, explorers, delvers, and investigators.
In addition to improving your agility and stealth, you learn skills useful for delving into ancient ruins, reading unfamiliar languages, and using magic items you normally couldn't employ.
Add the following four exploits to your list of exploit options: heist, pickpocket, robbery, and slink.

items.name: Heist
entries: When you make an ability check and use Deception or Sleight of Hand, you can roll 1d6 and add it to the result. You can wait until after you roll your check before deciding to use this exploit, but you must decide before the GM says whether your check succeeds or fails.

entries.name: Greater Heist:
entries: (5:e nivån) Din bonus ökar från 1d6 till 1d8.

entries.name: Superior Heist:
entries: (9:e nivån) Din bonus ökar från 1d8 till 1d10.

items.name: Pickpocket
entries: When you hit an adjacent Large or smaller creature with a melee weapon attack and you have at least one free hand, you can attempt to pickpocket it. The creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. If it fails, you take hold of one item of your choice that the creature carries and is not currently wearing or wielding. You must be able to hold your pickpocketed item comfortably with one hand. If you had advantage on your attack roll, the creature is not immediately aware that they have been pickpocketed by you.

entries.name: Greater Pickpocket:
entries: (5:e nivån) Du kan använda den här bedriften mot enorma varelser.

entries.name: Superior Pickpocket:
entries: (9:e nivån) Du kan använda den här bedriften mot Gargantuan-varelser.

items.name: Robbery
entries: When you deal your sneak attack damage to a Large or smaller creature, you can attempt to make the creature drop an item. The creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. If it fails, the creature drops one item of your choice that it is holding. If you are adjacent to the creature, you can catch the dropped item if you are unrestrained and have at least one free hand.

entries.name: Greater Robbery:
entries: (5:e nivån) Du kan använda den här bedriften mot enorma varelser.

entries.name: Superior Robbery:
entries: (9:e nivån) Du kan använda den här bedriften mot Gargantuan-varelser.

items.name: Slink
entries: When a creature hits you with an attack roll and you are not incapacitated, you can spend your reaction and attempt to evade the attack. Roll 1d6 and add the result to your AC—if the attack roll doesn't beat your slink AC, it misses.

entries.name: Greater Slink:
entries: (5th-level) You may roll 1d8 when you attempt to slink.

entries.name: Superior Slink:
entries: (9th-level) You may roll 1d10 when you attempt to slink.

subclassFeature.name: Fast Hands
entries: You can spend a bonus action to make a Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) check, use your thieves' tools to disarm a trap or open a lock, or take the {@action Use an Object} action.

subclassFeature.name: Second-Story Work
entries: You gain the ability to climb faster than normal—climbing no longer costs you extra movement.
In addition, whenever you make a running jump, the distance you cover increases by a number of feet equal to your Dexterity modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Supreme Sneak
entries: You have advantage on a Dexterity (Stealth) check if you move no more than half your speed on the same turn.

subclassFeature.name: Stolen Secrets
entries: You have acquired enough magical knowledge that you can now improvise the use of items—even when they are not intended for you. You ignore all class, race, and level requirements on the use of magic items.

entries.name: Spellcasting:
entries: If an item requires you to use your own spellcasting ability when you cast a spell from the item, your spellcasting ability modifier is +0.

subclassFeature.name: Origin Spells
entries: Your bloodline offers you the following origin spells.

subclassFeature.name: Chaos Incarnate
entries: Whenever you cast spells that require an attack roll. You trigger a wild surge anytime you roll a natural 1. Whenever you cast a spell requiring a saving throw, you trigger a wild surge anytime a target gets a natural 20 on its saving throw roll.

subclassFeature.name: Tides of Chaos
entries: Starting at 1st level, you can manipulate the forces of chance and chaos to gain advantage on one attack roll, ability check, or saving throw. Once you do so, you must finish a long rest before you can use this feature again. Any time before you regain the use of this feature, the DM can have you roll on the Wild Magic Surge table immediately after you cast a sorcerer spell of 1st level or higher. You then regain the use of this feature {@note (text incomplete)}

subclassFeature.name: Metamagic
entries: Add the following four metamagics to your list of metamagic options: {@optfeature slots|AACC}, {@optfeature displacement|AACC}, {@optfeature arcane rebuke|AACC}, and {@optfeature bend luck|AACC}.

subclassFeature.name: Play the Odds
entries: If you fail an ability check, saving throw, or attack roll, you can spend 1 sorcery point to attempt a re-roll of one of the dice involved in the check, attack, or save. However, if you fail using the reroll, your next three d20 rolls are made at disadvantage.

subclassFeature.name: Beacon of Chaos
entries: When a creature within 60 ft. of you casts a spell or uses a spell-like ability, you can use your reaction to spend a healing surge {@note (Probably means hit die)}, and a number of sorcery points equal to the cost of casting a spell of that spell level (DM must assign a value to spell-like abilities). Any attack rolls made with that spell are made at disadvantage and any saves against the spell are made with advantage. You and the Caster each become the target of a wild surge.
You can use this ability a number of times equal to your charisma modifier before needing a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Metamorphosis
entries: You gain two metamorphosis forms: {@i avatar of chaos} (as shown below) and one other form randomly determined when you complete a long rest.

entries.name: Avatar of Chaos
entries: Your form changes every few seconds shifting painfully between an unimaginable collection of creatures.

entries.name: Shifting Resistances:
entries: On initiative count 20, roll to determine your current resistances. (roll twice on the table with all damage types, if you get the same result twice you gain immunity.) This changes each round.

entries.name: Untethered:
entries: You gain a flying speed equal to your current speed with hover. If you are still flying when your metamorphosis ends, you fall unless you can somehow prevent it.

entries.name: Gibbering Cacophony:
entries: You can spend an action to terrify those around you. Each creature that is (a) within 30 ft. of you and (b) can hear you; must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become confused as per the {@spell confusion||spell} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to your Gibbering Cacophony until the end of its next long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Bloodline
entries: Your blood carries with it the ancient power of draconic magic. Your lineage may include half-dragon, a sorcerer who made a blood bargain with a dragon, or perhaps even a dragon parent.
Those who carry this bloodline bear unmistakable traits of their dragon ancestors—physically and mentally.

subclassFeature.name: Origin Spells
entries: Your bloodline offers you the following origin spells.

subclassFeature.name: Metamagic
entries: Add the following four metamagics to your list of metamagic options: {@optfeature chromatic spell|GCC|chromatic}, {@optfeature empowered spell|GCC|empowered}, {@optfeature extended spell|GCC|extended}, and {@optfeature seeking spell|GCC|seeking}.

subclassFeature.name: Dragon Ancestor
entries: Choose one type of dragon as your {@table Dragon Ancestors|GCC|ancestor}. You can speak, read, and write Draconic. Whenever you make a Charisma check to interact with dragons, your proficiency bonus (if applicable) is doubled.

entries.name: Ancestor Availability
entries: The {@table Dragon Ancestors|GCC|Dragon Ancestor} table featured here contains a wide variety of dragon families—some, however, might not be appropriate for every game or campaign setting.
Before you pick an ancestor, check with your GM to see which draconic families are available in your setting.

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Resilience
entries: At 1st-level, your hit point maximum increases by +1. It increases by +1 again whenever you gain a sorcerer level.
Additionally, parts of your skin are covered by a thin sheen of dragon-like scales. When you aren't wearing armor, your AC equals 13 + your Dexterity modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Dragonbreath
entries: You can spend your action to exhale destructive energy. Your draconic ancestry determines the size, shape, and damage type of your breath.
Each creature in the area of your dragonbreath must make a saving throw—a creature takes {@damage 3d6} damage on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful one.
You may use this feature once. You regain expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Greater Dragonbreath:
entries: At 6th-level, the damage dealt by your dragonbreath increases from {@damage 3d6} to {@damage 4d6}. In addition, you may use this feature twice.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Affinity
entries: When you cast a spell that deals damage of the type associated with your draconic ancestry, you can add your Charisma modifier to one damage roll of that spell.
At the same time, you can spend 1 sorcery point to gain resistance to that damage type for 1 hour.

subclassFeature.name: Metamorphosis
entries: You gain two metamorphosis forms: {@i draconic} and one other form as based on your draconic ancestry damage type.

entries.name: Draconic
entries: Draconic scales cover your body as large, leathery wings burst from your back. Those who look upon you face the might—and the terror—of dragonkind.

entries.name: Dragonscale:
entries: You have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks.

entries.name: Dragonflight:
entries: You gain a flying speed equal to your current speed. If you are still flying when your metamorphosis ends, you fall unless you can somehow prevent it.

entries.name: Terrifying Presence:
entries: You can spend an action to terrify those around you. Each creature that is (a) within 30 ft. of you and (b) aware of you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition Frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to your {@i Terrifying} Presence until the end of its next long rest.

subclassFeature.name: The Cosmic Terror
entries: Your patron is a mysterious entity whose nature is utterly foreign to the fabric of reality. Its motives are incomprehensible to mortals, and its knowledge so immense and ancient that even the greatest libraries pale in comparison to the vast secrets it holds. The Cosmic Terror might be unaware of your existence or entirely indifferent to you, but the secrets you have learned allow you to draw your magic from it.

subclassFeature.name: Demands
entries: Magic drawn from the Cosmic Terror is incomprehensibly traumatic for the mind to endure. To maintain sanity you've developed a number of coping mechanisms to give your mind an edge.

items: {@b Maintain Constant Pursuit of Knowledge.} Gather information and use it to your advantage. Surpass psychological barriers to uncover what is concealed and discover even the most unspeakable, unfathomable truths. Better to know too much than to go insane while wondering.
{@b Expand your Circle of Influence.} Seek power, wealth, alliances, etc. Arm yourself with anything you can control and keep on it an iron grasp.

{@b Fear the Void.} Know that nowhere is truly safe from your patron and teach others to know it too. Shining a light on the inevitability of impending doom with others diminishes the loneliness of apodictic insignificance.

subclassFeature.name: Patron Spells
entries: Add the following pact spells to the warlock spell list.

entries.caption: Patron Spells
outro: * Instead of percieving everything as funny, the target percieves everything as horrifyingly paralyzing. This does not affect the conditions administered by the spell.

subclassFeature.name: Psychic Leak
entries: Your alien knowledge gives you the ability to touch the minds of other creatures. You can communicate telepathically with any creature you can see within 30 feet of you. You don't need to share a language with the creature for it to understand your telepathic utterances, but the creature must be able to understand at least one language.

Additionally, you can use a bonus action to force a target of your telepathy to make a Wisdom save against your spell save DC or become frightened of you for 1 minute. They can repeat the save at the start of every subsequent turn. You regain the use of this ability on a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Patron Invocations
entries: Add the following invocations to your list of Eldritch Invocation options.

items: {@optfeature Vulture's Eye|GCC}
{@optfeature Eldritch Tendrils|GCC}
{@optfeature Jaws of Impending Doom|GCC}
{@optfeature The Unnameable|GCC}
{@optfeature Cosmic Insight|GCC}
{@optfeature Extrasensory Despair|GCC}

subclassFeature.name: Curator of Terror
entries: You have learned horrid methods of amplifying existing fears, and expose fears in people they did not know they had. You can use a free action to prevent a creature with the frightened condition from taking the attack, grapple, disarm, cast a spell, or dodge action while it remains frightened. You can use this ability a number of times equal to your spellcasting ability modifier.

Additionally, creatures within 10 feet of you have disadvantage on saving throws against spells and abilities you cast that apply the frightened condition, and you can use an action instead of a bonus action to target an additional creature with {@i Psychic Leak}.

subclassFeature.name: Dominate Xenophobe
entries: You gain the ability to infect a humanoid's psyche with the mind-melting magic of your patron, a witness to the same existential torment you've endured up to this point. You can use your action to touch an incapacitated humanoid who is hostile towards you. That creature must make a charisma saving throw or be charmed by you until you use this feature again. Once this ability ends, the creature knows it was charmed, but cannot intuit who charmed it of its own volition.
While you and your thrall are on the same plane of existance, you can both communicate telepathically and gain immunity to psychic damage.
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: The Cult
entries: Tireless efforts and peerless ambition; the untimely demise of the former cult leader; coincidence, happenstance or luck. The Cult cares not how you came to lead them. The only thing that matters now is you. You are their guiding voice. Their sheath. Their dagger.

You have made a pact with The Cult, and its followers—your followers—are everywhere. They work in secret, never revealing themselves—even to each other. Nobody knows which guard, merchant, or adventurer may be one of your cultists. One would be foolish to try and find out.
As a Warlock of The Cult, you gain the following features:

subclassFeature.name: Demands
entries: The Cult draws power from the link between its cultists and is always hungry for more. As all good cultists do, you must play your part to sate this hunger. It is for the greater good.

items: {@b Gather Information.} Hidden knowledge, ancient lore, and whispered secrets often reveal deep fonts of power. Seek them out and acquire them for The Cult.
{@b Keep to the Shadows.} Many people don't yet understand the serenity that The Cult can offer. Many will try to break you. They won't be able to if they don't know who you are.
{@b Assimilate, Sacrifice, Grow.} Welcome the willing into The Cult with open arms then sway them into sacrifice with the promise of power. The Cult will flourish beautifully.

subclassFeature.name: Patron Spells
entries: Add the following pact spells to the warlock spell list.

subclassFeature.name: Silver Tongue
entries: You have advantage on Charisma (Deception) and Charisma (Persuasion) checks when interacting with a creature that hasn't met you before.

subclassFeature.name: Cultists
entries: As the leader of The Cult, you have a circle of cultists willing to channel power to you at a moment's notice. They are represented by a Cultists die—a cascading die that can be 'upgraded' or 'downgraded' to the next larger or smaller size in the following cascading chain:

The size of your Cultists die represents the magnitude of how many cultists follow your deeds, the influence that The Cult has on the world, and how much power you are able to siphon from your cultists at a moment's notice.

entries.name: Rolling High & Low
entries: When you roll your Cultists die, your roll is considered {@b high} if the result is one of the highest two numbers on the die or {@b low} if the result is a 1 or a 2.

entries.name: Assimilation & Sacrifice
entries: Your Cultists die is upgraded to the next larger size when a feature tells you to {@b assimilate} new cultists. Conversely, it is downgraded to the next smaller size when a feature tells you to {@b sacrifice} some cultists. Your Cultists die starts as a d4 (the minimum size of the die), and cannot be upgraded above a d12.

entries.name: Sigil Conduit
entries: All cultists are marked with The Cult's unique, eldritch sigil. This sigil is a conduit that allows each cultist to share their power with one another—willingly or otherwise. Describe the sigil, where it marks your form, and what the initiation ritual was to receive it.

entries.name: Cult Rituals
entries: During a long rest in a town, you may sneak away from your companions to perform an Assimilation or Sacrificial ritual. Choose which you want to perform, roll your Cultists die, and refer to the Ritual table to see what happens.

If you gained eldritch power, you can two effects from the {@spell enhance ability} spell. Otherwise, if your roll was neither high nor low, you gain one effect. These effects replace any other similar effects and last for 24 hours.

There are only so many people that you can assimilate in one town, but people tend to forget with time. Once you have assimilated cultists in a town, you cannot do so again until you leave that town for a while. Your DM will say how long.

entries.name: You've Betrayed Our Trust... For Now.
entries: Talk with your DM about how townsfolk might react to you when they are wary. Perhaps they will increase their prices, mistrust your actions, act fearful toward you, or become quick to alert guards when you are nearby.

subclassFeature.name: Patron Invocations
entries: Add the following invocations to your list of Eldritch Invocation options.

items: {@optfeature Mind's Eye|GCC}
{@optfeature Fluctuating Energy|GCC}
{@optfeature Eldritch Strike|GCC}
{@optfeature Your Life is Mine|GCC}
{@optfeature Fortress of Flesh|GCC}
{@optfeature The Power of Many|GCC}

subclassFeature.name: Strange Mask
entries: You realise that you have a strange mask in your possession. It is branded with The Cult's sigil but you can't quite recall ever picking it up or where it came from.

subclassFeature.name: The Strength and Power of Flesh
entries: {@i Requires at least d10 cultists}
As an action, you can {@b sacrifice} some cultists to perform a Cult Ritual. You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: I'm Not Me... You Are
entries: {@i Requires d12 cultists}
When you are killed, you didn't die—it was one of your cultists. The body disintegrates in a wreathe of eldritch flames. Which one of you is even real any more?
Roll your Cultists die once to determine how much of an impact this death has on The Cult.

rows: Calamitous. Your soul disintegrates along with your body, you cannot be revived.
Huge. {@b Sacrifice} until your Cultists die is a {@b d4}.
Significant. {@b Sacrifice} until your Cultists die is a {@b d6}.
Moderate. {@b Sacrifice} until your Cultists die is a {@b d8}.
Minimal. {@b Sacrifice} until your Cultists die is a {@b d10}.

entries: Swap one of your language or skill proficiencies for a new one, then change one superficial, physical aspect about your character (such as the colour of your eyes, hair, or skin, the size of your nose, your stature, a scar on your face, and so on).
When your party reaches another village, town, or city, "you" may rejoin them.

subclassFeature.name: The Fey
entries: Your patron is a lord or lady of the fey, a creature of legend who holds secrets that were forgotten before the mortal races were born. This being's motivations are often inscrutable, and sometimes whimsical, and might involve a striving for greater magical power or the settling of age-old grudges. Beings of this sort include the Prince of Frost; the Queen of Air and Darkness, ruler of the Gloaming Court; Titania of the Summer Court; her consort Oberon, the Green Lord; Hyrsam, the Prince of Fools; and ancient hags.
As a Warlock of the Fey, you gain the following features:

subclassFeature.name: Demands
entries: The Fey has an agenda in the world, and you are a small piece of it. To be worthy of your patron's power, you must honor their demands.

items: {@b Listen attentively:} You are my eyes and ears in the mortal world. Pay attention, learn much, and gather for me secrets.
{@b Everything has a price:} Never give anything away for free, the multiverse demands balance, if you give you must also be empowering yourself to take.
{@b Your word is your bond:} Do not give your word recklessly, if you swear an oath or make a promise and fail to fulfill it, it reflects poorly on me. And you will know my displeasure.

subclassFeature.name: Patron Spells
entries: Add the following pact spells to the warlock spell list.

subclassFeature.name: Step Away
entries: When an attack misses you, you may use your reaction to teleport to any location within 5 ft. that you can see.

subclassFeature.name: Patron Invocations
entries: Add the following invocations to your list of Eldritch Invocation options.

items: {@optfeature Actions Unmade|GCC}
{@optfeature Blessing of Sylph|GCC}
{@optfeature Courtier|GCC}
{@optfeature Fey Magics|GCC}
{@optfeature Fey-like Being|GCC}
{@optfeature Misty Escape|GCC}

subclassFeature.name: Beguiling Defenses
entries: Your patron teaches you how to turn the mind-affecting magic of your enemies against them. You are immune to being charmed, and when another creature attempts to charm you, you can use your reaction to attempt to turn the charm back on that creature. The creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your warlock spell save DC or be charmed by you for 1 minute or until the creature takes any damage.

subclassFeature.name: Walker of the Ways
entries: As an action you may teleport up to 60 ft. to a location you can see.

subclassFeature.name: The Fiend
entries: You have made a pact with a fiend from the lower planes of existence—a being whose aims are evil, even if you yourself struggle against those aims. Fiends seek to corrupt, dominate, or destroy all things—including {@i you}.

subclassFeature.name: Demands
entries: The Fiend has an agenda in the world, and you are a small piece of it. To be worthy of your patron's power, you must honor their demands.

items: {@b Worship No Other:} Your patron is not the sharing type. Don't worship any other power, and subvert the influence of those that do.
{@b Seek Power and Position:} Gain influence so that you can better serve your patron's agenda. Take power when you can, and never give up power willingly.
{@b Convert or Control:} Convert others into the service of your patron. Those you can't convert you should manipulate into serving your patron unknowingly.

subclassFeature.name: Patron Spells
entries: Add the following pact spells to the warlock spell list.

subclassFeature.name: Dark One's Blessing
entries: When you reduce a hostile creature to 0 hit points, you gain temporary hit points equal to your Intelligence modifier + your warlock level (minimum of 1).

subclassFeature.name: Patron Invocations
entries: Add the following invocations to your list of Eldritch Invocation options.

items: {@optfeature Devil's Flock|GCC}
{@optfeature Fiendish Flesh|GCC}
{@optfeature Fiendish Senses|GCC}
{@optfeature Fiery Tongue|GCC}
{@optfeature Hell's Quarrel|GCC}
{@optfeature Hellish Companion|GCC}

subclassFeature.name: Dark One's Own Luck
entries: When you make an ability check or a saving throw, you can add a d10 to your roll. You can do so after seeing the initial roll but before any of the roll's effects occur.
Du kan använda den här funktionen upp till tre gånger. Du återfår förbrukade användningar när du avslutar en lång vila.

subclassFeature.name: Fiendish Resilience
entries: Choose one damage type when you finish a short or long rest. You gain resistance to that damage type until you choose a different one with this feature. Damage from magical weapons or silver weapons ignores this resistance.

subclassFeature.name: The Greater Dead
entries: As a Warlock of the Greater Dead, you gain the following features:

items: {@b All Life Must End.} Do not work to extend the life of others. Slay your foes without mercy.
{@b Waste Not.} The dead are tools to be used. No sense letting them rot in the ground.
{@b Consolidate Power.} The meek shall inherit nothing.

subclassFeature.name: Patron Spells
entries: Add the following pact spells to the warlock spell list.

subclassFeature.name: Greater Skeleton
entries: You can spend 1 minute to reanimate one corpse or pile of bones into a greater skeleton. It is loyal to you and it obeys your commands. The greater skeleton lasts until it dies or you spend an action to dispel the magic animating it. See this creature's game statistics in the greater skeleton stat block. You can have a number of greater skeletons equal to your proficiency bonus minus 1. If you attempt to raise another greater skeleton while at your limit, the oldest immediately collapses into a pile of bones.

In combat, the greater skeleton shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. On each of your turns, you can use a bonus action to mentally command any greater skeleton you made with this feature if the greater skeleton is within 100 feet of you (if you control multiple greater skeletons, you can command any or all of them at the same time, issuing the same command to each one). You decide what action the greater skeleton will take and where it will move during its next turn, or you can issue a general command, such as to guard a particular chamber or corridor. If you issue no commands, the greater skeleton only defends itself against hostile creatures. Once given an order, the greater skeleton continues to follow it until its task is complete.

dataCreature.name: Greater Skeleton
languages: understands all languages you know but can't speak

trait.name: Shared Proficiency
entries: The Greater Skeleton has proficiency in any weapon and armor that you do. It also uses your proficiency bonus.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: Unarmed Melee Attack: Strength modifier + proficiency bonus, reach 5 ft., one target you can see. {@h}{@damage 1d4} + Strength modifier bludgeoning damage.

subclassFeature.name: Patron Invocations
entries: Add the following invocations to your list of Eldritch Invocation options.

items: {@optfeature Blast Bones|GCC}
{@optfeature Eldritch Empowerment|GCC}
{@optfeature On a Pale Horse|GCC}
{@optfeature Undying Focus|GCC}
{@optfeature Spectral Sight|GCC}
{@optfeature Command the Dreadhorde|GCC}

subclassFeature.name: Death Mark
entries: When you deal damage to a creature with a weapon attack or spell, you can use your reaction to mark the creature for death. The next time one of your greater skeletons deals damage to the marked creature, that creature takes an additional {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage.

subclassFeature.name: Unholy Mastery
entries: You and your greater skeletons ignore resistance to necrotic damage and treat immunity as resistance. Additionally, when you roll damage for a spell you cast that deals necrotic damage, you can treat any 1 on a damage die as a 2.

subclassFeature.name: The Huntress
entries: As a Warlock of the Huntress, you gain the following features:

items: {@b Pursue.} Never let your prey escape.
{@b Show Restraint.} To kill meaninglessly leads only to instability, both in nature and society.
{@b Steel your Resolve.} Retreat when advantageous but never let fear overtake your nerves..

subclassFeature.name: Patron Spells
entries: Add the following pact spells to the warlock spell list.

subclassFeature.name: Unnatural Calm
entries: Starting at 1st level, your parton bestows you with a calmed state and heightened awareness. You can use a Bonus Action to enter Unnatural Calm which lasts for 1 minute. It ends early if you are Incapacitated.
While your Unnatural Calm is active, you gain the following benefits:

items: When you make a ranged attack roll, the range is doubled
You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks
You gain a bonus to any Constitution saving throw you make to maintain your concentration. This bonus equals your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1).
You have advantage on saving throws against the Frightened condition

entries: Once you use this feature you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Patron Invocations
entries: Add the following invocations to your list of Eldritch Invocation options.

items: {@optfeature Hunters Prowess|GCC}
{@optfeature Quick Draw|GCC}
{@optfeature Thrill of the Hunt|GCC}
{@optfeature Arcane Disengage|GCC}
{@optfeature Call of the Wild|GCC}
{@optfeature Eye for the Hidden|GCC}

subclassFeature.name: Preternatural Precision
entries: Starting at 6th level, your patron grants you increased accuracy in exchange for your vitality. When you miss a ranged attack, you may spend a Hit Die and add it to the attack roll, potentially changing the result. Additionally, you may use your Unnatural Calm twice between rests.

subclassFeature.name: Unerring Shot
entries: Starting at 10th level, as an action you mark a creature you can see. The mark is removed if the creature is on a different plane, the creature dies, or you lose concentration (as if concentrating on a spell). Your next ranged attack against the marked creature automatically scores a critical hit. The projectile magically follows the target changing trajectory if needed and piercing through any barrier that can not be avoided.

subclassFeature.name: Chronurgy Magic
entries: As a Chronurgy Wizard, you gain the following features:

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Schools
entries: You gain the following features for your favored and clashing magic schools.

entries.name: Favored School
entries: You have a talent for reading the glyphs and symbols of {@i Enchantment} magic. The amount of gold and time you must spend to write an Enchantment spell into your spellbook is halved.

entries.name: Clashing School
entries: You find it more difficult to make sense of the sigils and writing structure of {@i Evocation} magic. The amount of gold and time you must spend to write an evocation spell into your spellbook is doubled.

subclassFeature.name: Chronal Shift
entries: Your clever manipulation of the flow of battle gives you the ability to twist the stings of time in your favor. When a creature makes an attack roll against you, if you have not yet acted in the turn order, you can choose to take your turn before they make their attack roll. Once you end your turn, the creature's turn continues as normal, and your turn in the initiative order is skipped.
You can use this ability twice, and you regain any expended uses when you finish a long rest.
In addition, you can add your Intelligence modifier to your initiative rolls.

subclassFeature.name: Slug Step
entries: As an action, you can slow time around a creature to decelerate their movement. A Large or smaller creature of your choice that you can see within 60 feet of you must make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failure, the creature is slowed, reducing their speed by half, and preventing them from taking reactions until the end of your next turn or until the creature takes any damage.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (a minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Abeyance
entries: When you cast a spell using a spell slot of 4th level or lower, you can condense the spell's magic into a mote. The spell is frozen in time at the moment of casting and held within a gray bead for 1 hour. This bead is a Tiny object with AC 15 and 1 hit point, and it is immune to poison and psychic damage. When the duration ends, or if the bead is destroyed, it vanishes in a flash of light, and the spell is lost.

A creature holding the bead can use its action to release the spell within, whereupon the bead disappears. The spell uses your spell attack bonus and save DC, and the spell treats the creature who released it as the caster for all other purposes.
Once you create a bead with this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Convergent Future
entries: You can peer through possible futures and magically pull one of them into events around you, ensuring a particular outcome. You can spend an action to Temporally Lock a creature until the end of their next turn. Choose a creature you can see within 60 feet of you. The GM or player who controls that character must declare the next action and movement path that creature will take as if they are taking their turn during your turn. The initiative order continues as normal but once it gets to that creature's turn, the creature must make the same movement path and action that they have declared.

If the Temporally Locked creature declared they would attack a creature, but that creature has moved by the time they take their attack action, they can choose to attack a different target in range with the same weapon so long as that creature remains within range. If they break up their movement, they must attack after moving the same distance as they declared.
You can use this feature again when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Graviturgy Magic
entries: As a Graviturgy Wizard, you gain the following features:

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Schools
entries: You gain the following features for your favored and clashing magic schools.

entries.name: Favored School
entries: You have a talent for reading the glyphs and symbols of {@i one chosen school of magic}. The gold and time you must spend to write a spell from the chosen school into your spellbook is halved.

entries.name: Clashing School
entries: You find it more difficult to make sense of the sigils and writing structure of {@i one chosen school of magic}. The gold and time you must spend to write a spell from the chosen school into your spellbook is doubled.

subclassFeature.name: Adjust Density
entries: As an action, you can magically alter the weight of one object or creature you can see within 30 feet of you. The object or creature must be Large or smaller. The target's weight is halved or doubled for up to 1 minute or until your concentration ends (as if you were concentrating on a spell).

While the weight of a creature is halved by this effect, the creature's speed increases by 10 feet, it can jump twice as far as normal, and it has disadvantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws. While the weight of a creature is doubled by this effect, the creature's speed is reduced by 10 feet, and it has advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws.
Upon reaching 10th level in this class, you can target an object or a creature that is Huge or smaller.

subclassFeature.name: Gravity Well
entries: You've learned how to manipulate gravity around a living being: whenever you cast a spell on a creature, you can move the target 5 feet to an unoccupied space of your choice if the target is willing to move, the spell hits it with an attack, or it fails a saving throw against the spell.

subclassFeature.name: Violent Attraction
entries: When another creature that you can see within 60 feet of you hits with a weapon attack, you can use your reaction to increase the attack's velocity, causing the attack's target to take an extra 1d10 damage of the weapon's type.
Alternatively, if a creature within 60 feet of you takes damage from a fall, you can use your reaction to increase the fall's damage by {@damage 2d10}.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (a minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Event Horizon
entries: As an action, you can magically emit a powerful field of gravitational energy that tugs at other creatures for up to 1 minute or until your concentration ends (as if you were concentrating on a spell). For the duration, whenever a creature hostile to you starts its turn within 30 feet of you, it must make a Strength saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, it takes {@damage 2d10} force damage, and its speed is reduced to 0 until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage, and every foot it moves this turn costs 2 extra feet of movement.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest or until you expend a spell slot of 3rd level or higher on it.

subclassFeature.name: Hedge Witch
entries: A Hedge Witch or Wizard is not formally trained in magic but instead learns by doing. This gives many Hedge Witches a more pragmatic view on magic.
As a Hedge Witch, you gain the following features:

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Schools
entries: You gain the following features for your favored and clashing magic schools.

entries.name: Favored School
entries: You have a talent for reading the glyphs and symbols of {@i basic} magic. The gold and time you must spend to write 1st and 2nd level spells into your spellbook is halved.

entries.name: Clashing School
entries: You find it more difficult to make sense of the sigils and writing structure of {@i complex} magic. The gold and time you must spend to write a spell of 3rd level or higher into your spellbook is doubled.

subclassFeature.name: Practiced Ritualist
entries: When you cast a spell as a ritual, you can use the spell's normal casting time, rather than adding 10 minutes to it.

subclassFeature.name: Spell Savvy
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you may combine and split your spell slots. When you finish a long rest you may choose to exchange any number of spell slots and trade them for a number of 1st level slots equal to their level. For example, a 2nd level spell slot can be traded for 2 bonus 1st level spell slots while a 5th level spell slot would become 5 1st level slots. You can also combine spell slots, exchanging 2 slots of the same level for 1 spell slot of the next level up. When combining spells the new slot must be of a level you already have at least 1 spell slot.

subclassFeature.name: It'll Do in a Pinch
entries: Beginning at 6th level, when you cast a spell that has a material component with a value listed in gold pieces, you can instead use components worth half the listed value.

subclassFeature.name: Tradition Be Damned
entries: By 10th level, you have learned that magic is magic and segregation is a hold over from a bygone era. You may copy spells from scrolls into your spellbook even if they aren't on the wizard spell list. Spells added to your spellbook using this feature count as wizard spells for you.

subclassFeature.name: School of Abjuration
entries: As an Abjuration Wizard, you gain the following features:

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Schools
entries: You gain the following features for your favored and clashing magic schools.

entries.name: Favored School
entries: You have a talent for reading the glyphs and symbols of {@i Abjuration} magic. The gold and time you must spend to write a divination spell into your spellbook is halved.

entries.name: Clashing School
entries: You find it more difficult to make sense of the sigils and writing structure of {@i Divination} magic. The gold and time you must spend to write a spell into your spellbook is doubled.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Ward
entries: Starting at 1st level, you can weave magic around yourself for protection. When you cast an abjuration spell of 1st level or higher, you can simultaneously use a strand of the spell's magic to create a magical ward on yourself that lasts until you finish a long rest. The ward has hit points equal to twice your wizard level + your Intelligence modifier. Whenever you take damage, the ward takes the damage instead. If this damage reduces the ward to 0 hit points, you take any remaining damage.

While the ward has 0 hit points, it can't absorb damage, but its magic remains. Whenever you cast an abjuration spell of 1st level or higher, the ward regains a number of hit points equal to twice the level of the spell.
Once you create the ward, you can't create it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Projected Ward
entries: Starting at 3rd level, when a creature that you can see within 30 feet of you takes damage, you can use your reaction to cause your Arcane Ward to absorb that damage. If this damage reduces the ward to 0 hit points, the warded creature takes any remaining damage.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Abjuration
entries: Beginning at 6th level, when you cast an abjuration spell that requires you to make an ability check as a part of casting that spell (as in {@spell counterspell} and {@spell dispel magic}), you add your proficiency bonus to that ability check.

subclassFeature.name: Spell Resistance
entries: Starting at 10th level, you have advantage on saving throws against spells.
Furthermore, you have resistance against the damage of spells.

subclassFeature.name: School of Biomancy
entries: As a Biomancy Wizard, living flesh is your canvas, and you are able to shape and craft it into something beautiful.
As a Biomancy Wizard, you gain the following features:

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Schools
entries: You gain the following features for your favored and clashing magic schools.

entries.name: Favored School
entries: You have a talent for reading the glyphs and symbols of {@i transmutation} magic. The amount of gold and time you must spend to write a {@i transmutation} spell into your spellbook is halved.

entries.name: Clashing School
entries: You find it more difficult to make sense of the sigils and writing structure of {@i illusion} magic. The amount of gold and time you must spend to write an {@i illusion} spell into your spellbook is doubled.

subclassFeature.name: Familiar in the Flesh
entries: You learn the {@spell Find Familiar} spell if you don't already know it. Your familiar is a monstrosity instead of a celestial and a combination of two available familiars. This combination is purely aesthetic as it only uses the statblock of one of the two familiars it is made of. To dismiss your familiar, it must touch you and retreat into the pores of your skin.

subclassFeature.name: Mold Limbs
entries: Your limbs are malleable flesh which can be reshaped through various mutations. As an action, you can mold one limb into another type of limb. When you do so, you may relocate the limb to sprout from another place on your body and/or choose one of the following benefits, which lasts for 10 minutes. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier, minimum of 1, and regain expended uses on a long rest.

You can also use this ability on allies. When you target a willing creature with a spell, you can consume a use of this ability to mold their limbs with this ability as if you were using this ability on yourself.
At 3rd level, you can mold two limbs at a time when you use this ability.
At 6th level, you can mold three limbs at a time when you use this ability.

{@b Warp Blight} While a limb is molded, an arm is too unfamiliar be used to form the somatic components of spells, wield weapons, or wear shields, and a leg is too unfamiliar to be used to perform the dash action.

entries.name: Flesh Limb
entries: You distort the flesh of a limb to increase its length. Your Flesh Limb gains a reach of 10 feet. You can use a free action to pull yourself toward a surface you can grab with this limb or a creature grappled by this limb toward yourself provided this limb has not acted this turn. This movement provokes opportunity attacks as normal.
{@b Greater Flesh Limb} (5th level) Your reach with flesh limbs increases to 15 feet.
{@b Superior Flesh Limb} (9th level) Your reach with flesh limbs increases to 20 feet.

entries.name: Bone Limb
entries: You reinforce a limb with bone fragments to increase the lethality of your unarmed strikes. Unarmed strikes with this limb deal {@damage 1d4} + Str piercing damage. By having at least one bone limb active you gain an AC of 12 + your dexterity modifier. When you attack with a bone limb and you have multiple bone limbs, you can add the damage dice but not the modifier of each additional bone limb.
{@b Greater Bone Limb} (5th level) The damage die from bone limbs increases to a {@damage d6}.
{@b Superior Bone Limb} (9th level) The damage die from bone limbs increases to a {@damage d8}.

entries.name: Blood Limb
entries: You mold a limb into liquid blood to transfuse with and absorb the blood of a creature that has died within the last minute. When you spend an action to absorb a corpse's blood, spend a hit die to recover hit points equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Constitution modifier. You can't use this ability on the same target twice. If the creature has a different hit dice size and/or constitution modifier than yours, use theirs. If they don't have a hit dice size, use yours and limit them to 3 uses per long rest.
{@b Greater Blood Limb} (5th level) This ability heals you for {@dice 2d6} + Con Hit Points.
{@b Superior Blood Limb} (9th level) This ability heals you for {@dice 3d6} + Con Hit Points.

entries.name: Mucus Limb
entries: You coat all or part of your limb with sticky mucus, hairs, or suction cups. You use Intelligence instead of Strength to prevent escape with a mucus limb, and creatures have disadvantage on contests to escape from your grapples. If you have at least two mucus limbs you can move up, down, and across vertical surfaces and upside down along ceilings, with a climbing speed equal to your walking speed. If you use this ability on a creature other than yourself, they use your intelligence modifier to prevent escape from grapples, but their own speed to climb surfaces.
{@b Greater Mucus Limb} (5th level) After escaping the grapple of a mucus limb, the targets speed is reduced by 5 feet until the start of their next turn.
{@b Superior Mucus Limb} (9th level) After escaping the grapple of a mucus limb, the targets speed is reduced by 10 feet until the start of their next turn.

entries.name: Fluid Limb
entries: You transmogrify your limb into a form capable of propelling yourself through water, dirt, or air. Having one of these limbs gives you a swimming speed equal to half your base walking speed. This effect stacks with additional webbed limbs up to 4 times. Replacing a limb normally used to walk with this limb reduces your base walking speed by half of your base walking speed to a minimum of 0.
{@b Greater Fluid Limb} (5th level) You can choose to make the limb increase Burrowing Speed instead of Swimming Speed
{@b Superior Fluid Limb} (9th level) You can choose to make the limb increase Flying Speed instead of a Burrowing or Swimming Speed

subclassFeature.name: Spell Infection
entries: Starting at 3rd level, your spells can infect and mold the limbs of your enemies. When you hit a creature with a spell attack or that enemy fails a saving throw against a spell you cast of first level or higher, force that creature to make a constitution saving throw or one of their limbs gains warp blight. If used on a leg, this also reduces the target's base movement speed by half for the duration. The creature can make the saving throw again at the end of each of their turns to revert their limb back to normal. You can use this ability a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus.

subclassFeature.name: Experimental Mutation
entries: Beginning at 6th level, you can develop and test new ways of molding skin. As an action, you can designate a willing creature within 5 feet of you as a Morph. You can have a number of Morphs equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1) per long rest. The creature stays your Morph for 10 minutes. Each Morph can only have one Mutation at a time, but using this ability on the same creature again refreshes the abilities granted by the Morph or can change which Mutation the Morph uses. Add one of these Prototype Mutations to your list of Mutations at 6th level and another at 8th and 10th level.

entries.name: Camoflage Skin
entries: Your Morph gains the ability to change the color of its skin to match the environment. If your Morph has not moved this turn, your Morph can take the hide action with no cover when up against a wall that is larger than its own size category and cannot be discerned without inspection of the wall.

As an action, your Morph can change its physical appearance and voice three times per Mutation. It can determine the specifics of the changes, including its coloration, hair length, and sex. Your Morph can also adjust its height and weight, but not so much that its size or limb arrangement changes. It can make itself appear as a member of another race, though neither it's game statistics nor its voice change. Your Morph can't duplicate the appearance of a creature it has never seen, and its clothing and equipment aren't changed by this Mutation. Your Morph stays in the new form until it uses an action to revert to its true form, it dies, you become incapacitated, or the creature is no longer your Morph. Unlike other Morphs, this Morph lasts for up to 24 hours or until you take a long rest.

entries.name: Detatchable Limbs
entries: Your Morph can detatch its limbs and re-attatch them to other willing creatures and surfaces within 5 feet of it using an action. If it attaches a limb to a surface, the limb acts on your Morphs initiative count, as if the limb was still attached to its body. If your Morph attaches its limb to a creature, that creature gains control over the extra limb as if the limb were it's own. This does not grant the creature extra actions. The limb retains its Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution scores of its original owner. Once this Morph ends, any unattached limbs break apart into fleshy worms and wriggle back towards the owner to the best of its ability so long as the owner remains on the same plane of existence.

entries.name: Explosive Boils
entries: Your Morph can use a bonus action to cause one of its limbs to grow boils which spray blood and pus in a 20 foot cone starting from your Morph. Each creature within that space must make a Constitution Saving Throw or take {@damage 5d4} necrotic damage and grow thick calluses on their body, reducing their movement speed by half for 1 minute. They can repeat the saving throw at the end of each subsequent turn. After using this ability, that limb becomes unusable and cannot perform actions for 10 minutes or until molded.

entries.name: Ambimorpheus
entries: Your Morph sprouts two {@i Warp-Blighted} limbs from its back, which it can mold at will as a free action on its turn as if using the mold limbs ability on itself.

subclassFeature.name: Advanced Mold
entries: At 10th level, you have gained the ability to string separate limb types together. The limbs from your Mold Limbs ability can each have 2 different mutations at once, allowing 2 separate modifications to the same action. You cannot grapple a creature with an attack action or damage a creature with the grapple action in this way unless specified by another ability. Additionally, you can spend spell slots to use the Mold Limbs ability targetting yourself or an ally to mold a number of limbs equal to the spell level without spending uses of the Mold Limbs ability as normal.
{@b Blight Removal.} If you mold a limb with a single mutation, the limb will no longer be affected by Warp Blight until molded again.

subclassFeature.name: School of Conjuration
entries: As a Conjuration Wizard, you gain the following features:

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Schools
entries: You gain the following features for your favored and clashing magic schools.

entries.name: Favored School
entries: You have a talent for reading the glyphs and symbols of {@i Conjuration} magic. The gold and time you must spend to write a conjuration spell into your spellbook is halved.

entries.name: Clashing School
entries: You find it more difficult to make sense of the sigils and writing structure of {@i Enchantment} magic. The gold and time you must spend to write a spell into your spellbook is doubled.

subclassFeature.name: Minor Conjuration
entries: Starting at 1st level when you select this school, you can use your action to conjure up an inanimate object in your hand or on the ground in an unoccupied space that you can see within 10 feet of you. This object can be no larger than 3 feet on a side and weigh no more than 10 pounds, and its form must be that of a nonmagical object that you have seen. The object is visibly magical, radiating dim light out to 5 feet.
The object disappears after 1 hour, when you use this feature again, if it takes any damage, or if it deals any damage.

subclassFeature.name: Benign Transposition
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can use your action to teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space that you can see. Alternatively, you can choose a space within range that is occupied by a Small or Medium creature. If that creature is willing, you both teleport, swapping places.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest or you cast a conjuration spell of 1st level or higher.

subclassFeature.name: Focused Conjuration
entries: Beginning at 6th level, while you are concentrating on a conjuration spell, your concentration can't be broken as a result of taking damage.

subclassFeature.name: Durable Summons
entries: Starting at 10th level, any creature that you summon or create with a conjuration spell has 30 temporary hit points.

subclassFeature.name: School of Divination
entries: As a Divination Wizard, you gain the following features:

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Schools
entries: You gain the following features for your favored and clashing magic schools.

entries.name: Favored School
entries: You have a talent for reading the glyphs and symbols of {@i divination} magic. The gold and time you must spend to write a divination spell into your spellbook is halved.

entries.name: Clashing School
entries: You find it more difficult to make sense of the sigils and writing structure of {@i conjuration} magic. The gold and time you must spend to write an spell into your spellbook is doubled.

subclassFeature.name: The Third Eye
entries: Starting at 1st level, you can use your action to increase your powers of perception. When you do so, choose one of the following benefits, which lasts for 10 minutes. You can't use the feature again until you finish a rest.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You gain darkvision out to a range of 60 feet. If you already had darkvision, it increases by 60 feet.

entries.name: Ethereal Sight
entries: You can see into the Ethereal Plane within 30 feet of you.

entries.name: Greater Comprehension
entries: You can read any language.

entries.name: See Invisibility
entries: You can see invisible creatures and objects within 10 feet of you that are within line of sight.

subclassFeature.name: Portent
entries: Starting at 3rd level when you choose this school, glimpses of the future begin to press in on your awareness. When you finish a long rest, roll two d20s and record the numbers rolled. You can replace any attack roll, saving throw, or ability check made by you or a creature that you can see with one of these foretelling rolls. You must choose to do so before the roll, and you can replace a roll in this way only once per turn.
Each foretelling roll can be used only once. When you finish a long rest, you lose any unused foretelling rolls.

subclassFeature.name: Expert Divination
entries: Beginning at 6th level, casting divination spells comes so easily to you that it expends only a fraction of your spellcasting efforts. When you cast a divination spell of 2nd level or higher using a spell slot, you regain one expended spell slot. The slot you regain must be of a level lower than the spell you cast and can't be higher than 5th level.

subclassFeature.name: Greater Portent
entries: Starting at 6th level, the visions in your dreams intensify and paint a more accurate picture in your mind of what is to come. You roll three d20s for your Portent feature, rather than two.

subclassFeature.name: School of Enchantment
entries: As an Enchantment Wizard, you gain the following features:

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Schools
entries: You gain the following features for your favored and clashing magic schools.

entries.name: Favored School
entries: You have a talent for reading the glyphs and symbols of {@i Enchantment} magic. The gold and time you must spend to write a divination spell into your spellbook is halved.

entries.name: Clashing School
entries: You find it more difficult to make sense of the sigils and writing structure of {@i Conjuration} magic. The gold and time you must spend to write a spell into your spellbook is doubled.

subclassFeature.name: Hypnotic Gaze
entries: Starting at 1st level when you choose this school, your soft words and enchanting gaze can magically enthrall another creature. As an action, choose one creature that you can see within 5 feet of you. If the target can see or hear you, it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your wizard spell save DC or be charmed by you until the end of your next turn. The charmed creature's speed drops to 0, and the creature is incapacitated and visibly dazed.

On subsequent turns, you can use your action to maintain this effect, extending its duration until the end of your next turn. However, the effect ends if you move more than 5 feet away from the creature, if the creature can neither see nor hear you, or if the creature takes damage.
Once the effect ends, or if the creature succeeds on its initial saving throw against this effect, you can't use this feature on that creature again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Instinctive Charm
entries: Beginning at 3rd level, when a creature you can see within 30 feet of you makes an attack roll against you, you can use your reaction to divert the attack, provided that another creature is within the attack's range. The attacker must make a Wisdom saving throw against your wizard spell save DC. On a failed save, the attacker must target the creature that is closest to it, not including you or itself. If multiple creatures are closest, the attacker chooses which one to target. On a successful save, you can't use this feature on the attacker again until you finish a long rest.
You must choose to use this feature before knowing whether the attack hits or misses. Creatures that can't be charmed are immune to this effect.

subclassFeature.name: Split Enchantment
entries: Starting at 6th level, when you cast an enchantment spell of 1st level or higher that targets only one creature, you can have it target a second creature.

subclassFeature.name: Alter Memories
entries: At 10th level, you gain the ability to make a creature unaware of your magical influence on it. When you cast an enchantment spell to charm one or more creatures, you can alter one creature's understanding so that it remains unaware of being charmed.

Additionally, once before the spell expires, you can use your action to try to make the chosen creature forget some of the time it spent charmed. The creature must succeed on an Intelligence saving throw against your wizard spell save DC or lose a number of hours of its memories equal to 1 + your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1). You can make the creature forget less time, and the amount of time can't exceed the duration of your enchantment spell.

subclassFeature.name: School of Evocation
entries: You focus your study on magic that creates powerful elemental effects—bitter cold, searing flame, rolling thunder, crackling lightning, and burning acid.

Some evokers find employment in military forces, serving as artillery to blast enemy armies from afar. Others use their spectacular power to protect the weak, while some seek their own gain as bandits, adventurers, or aspiring tyrants.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Schools
entries: You gain the following features for your favored and clashing magic schools.

entries.name: Favored School
entries: You have a talent for reading the glyphs and symbols of {@i evocation} magic. The gold and time you must spend to write an evocation spell into your spellbook is halved.

entries.name: Clashing School
entries: You find it more difficult to make sense of the sigils and writing structure of {@i abjuration} magic. The gold and time you must spend to write an abjuration spell into your spellbook is doubled.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Spark
entries: When you cast a wizard evocation spell of 1st-level or higher that deals fire, cold, thunder, lightning, or acid damage, you can simultaneously create an elemental spark using a strand of the spell's power.

Your spark closely orbits your body—you may choose the location when you create the spark. The appearance and damage type of your spark match the spell that it was created from. You can only have one active elemental spark at a time, and any active spark expires automatically when you finish a short or long rest.
You can use this feature once, and you regain expended uses when you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Potent Cantrip
entries: You are able to rewrite your prepared cantrips so that your damaging cantrips can affect even creatures that avoid the brunt of the effect.
When a creature succeeds on a saving throw against your cantrip, the creature takes half the cantrip's damage (if any) but suffers no additional effect from the cantrip.

subclassFeature.name: Empowered Evocation
entries: You are able to enhance your evocation spells with destructive power.
When you cast a wizard evocation spell, you can add your Intelligence modifier to one damage roll.

subclassFeature.name: Overchannel
entries: When you cast a wizard spell of 1st to 5th-level that deals damage, you can choose to deal maximum damage with that spell. You must decide to do this before you roll damage for your spell.
Du kan använda den här egenskapen en gång, och du återfår de förbrukade användningarna när du avslutar en lång vila.

subclassFeature.name: School of Illusion
entries: As an Illusion Wizard, you gain the following features:

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Schools
entries: You gain the following features for your favored and clashing magic schools.

entries.name: Favored School
entries: You have a talent for reading the glyphs and symbols of {@i illusion} magic. The gold and time you must spend to write a divination spell into your spellbook is halved.

entries.name: Clashing School
entries: You find it more difficult to make sense of the sigils and writing structure of {@i conjuration} magic. The gold and time you must spend to write an spell into your spellbook is doubled.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Minor Illusion
entries: When you choose this school at 1st level, you learn the {@spell minor illusion} cantrip. If you already know this cantrip, you learn a different wizard cantrip of your choice. The cantrip doesn't count against your number of cantrips known.
When you cast {@spell minor illusion}, you can create both a sound and an image with a single casting of the spell.

subclassFeature.name: Malleable Illusions
entries: Starting at 3rd level, when you cast an illusion spell that has a duration of 1 minute or longer, you can use your action to change the nature of that illusion (using the spell's normal parameters for the illusion), provided that you can see the illusion.

subclassFeature.name: Illusory Step
entries: Beginning at 6th level, you can create an illusory duplicate of yourself as an instant, almost instinctual reaction to danger. When a creature makes an attack roll against you, you can use your reaction to interpose the illusory duplicate between the attacker and yourself. The attack automatically misses you, then the illusion dissipates.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Illusory Reality
entries: By 10th level, you have learned the secret of weaving shadow magic into your illusions to give them a semireality. When you cast an illusion spell of 1st level or higher, you can choose one inanimate, nonmagical object that is part of the illusion and make that object real. You can do this on your turn as a bonus action while the spell is ongoing. The object remains real for 1 minute. For example, you can create an illusion of a bridge over a chasm and then make it real long enough for your allies to cross.
The object can't deal damage or otherwise directly harm anyone.

subclassFeature.name: School of Necromancy
entries: As a Necromancy Wizard, you gain the following features:

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Schools
entries: You gain the following features for your favored and clashing magic schools.

entries.name: Favored School
entries: You have a talent for reading the glyphs and symbols of {@i Necromancy} magic. The gold and time you must spend to write a divination spell into your spellbook is halved.

entries.name: Clashing School
entries: You find it more difficult to make sense of the sigils and writing structure of {@i Evocation} magic. The gold and time you must spend to write a spell into your spellbook is doubled.

subclassFeature.name: Grim Harvest
entries: At 1st level, you gain the ability to reap life energy from creatures you kill with your spells. Once per turn when you kill one or more creatures with a spell of 1st level or higher, you regain hit points equal to twice the spell's level, or three times its level if the spell belongs to the School of Necromancy. You don't gain this benefit for killing constructs or undead.

subclassFeature.name: Loyal Spirit
entries: At 1st level add the {@spell find familiar} spell to your spellbook if it is not there already, this does not count against your total number of spells. Once per long rest you can substitute the corpse of a small or tiny best for the normal 10gp in incense. In this instance your familiar is treated as an undead and not a beast. If reduced to 0 hp the corpse is destroyed and the familiar is dispelled and must be resummoned. You can use this feature once per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Inured to Undeath
entries: Beginning at 3th level, you have resistance to necrotic damage, and your hit point maximum can't be reduced. You have spent so much time dealing with undead and the forces that animate them that you have become inured to some of their worst effects.

subclassFeature.name: Undead Thralls
entries: At 6rd level, you add the {@spell animate dead} spell to your spellbook if it is not there already. When you cast {@spell animate dead}, you can target one additional corpse or pile of bones, creating another zombie or skeleton, as appropriate.
Whenever you create an undead using a necromancy spell, it has additional benefits:

items: The creature's hit point maximum is increased by an amount equal to your wizard level.
The creature adds your proficiency bonus to its weapon damage rolls.

subclassFeature.name: Command Undead
entries: Starting at 10th level, you can use magic to bring undead under your control, even those created by other wizards. As an action, you can choose one undead that you can see within 60 feet of you. That creature must make a Charisma saving throw against your wizard spell save DC. If it succeeds, you can't use this feature on it again. If it fails, it becomes friendly to you and obeys your commands until you use this feature again.

Intelligent undead are harder to control in this way. If the target has an Intelligence of 8 or higher, it has advantage on the saving throw. If it fails the saving throw and has an Intelligence of 12 or higher, it can repeat the saving throw at the end of every hour until it succeeds and breaks free.

subclassFeature.name: School of Recollection
entries: Wizards who follow the tradition of Recollection believe that powerful magic lies within the memories of all things, from the creatures of the lands to the objects and places of the world. These wizards, known as ‘recollectionists' or ‘memorists', study ways of tapping into the power that lies in memories, and learn how to see visions of the past, recall spells and magic, and can even cause others to relive their memories, be they pleasant or foul. One can often find followers of this tradition working as historians, archaeologists, or even as guardians of ancient items and structures lost to time.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Schools
entries: You gain the following features for your favored and clashing magic schools.

entries.name: Favored School
entries: You have a talent for reading the glyphs and symbols of {@i divination} magic. The gold and time you must spend to write a divination spell into your spellbook is halved.

entries.name: Clashing School
entries: You find it more difficult to make sense of the sigils and writing structure of {@i conjuration} magic. The gold and time you must spend to write an spell into your spellbook is doubled.

subclassFeature.name: Spell Recollection
entries: Beginning when you choose this tradition at 1st level, you have unlocked a way to recall your arcane abilities. You can use this feature to cast a spell from your spellbook that you don't have prepared and that has a casting time of 1 action or 1 bonus action.
You can use this feature twice. You regain all expended uses of it when you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Relive Memories
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you have attuned yourself to the memories you have seen, and those you will see. As an action, you can touch one willing living creature, corpse, item, object, or part of a terrain or structure to see its memories. While maintaining touch, you see visions of events that the creature has or had seen or visions of events that took place regarding the item, object, part of a terrain, or structure. These visions can include wispy images of creatures that have interacted with what you are touching, voices of creature or who have spoken near or to what you are touching, or images of what you are touching has seen or what it used to look like. If you choose to not focus on a particular vision, you gain a summary of basic information that transpired related to what you are touching, such as simple weather events, physical depictions of people who interacted with what you are touching, or pieces of events that happened. If you choose to focus on a particular element of the visions, such as a particular person or event, all other visions appear blurred and muffled to you, and you see clearer depositions of the vision you are focusing on.

For every minute you spend maintaining touch, you can see one day's worth of visions. This amount increases to months at 6th level and years at 10th level. You can use this ability a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Reminding Spell
entries: By 6th level, you have learned how to cause a creature to remember a spell that it had cast upon it. As an action, choose a creature that you can see within 30 feet of you. If the creature is unwilling, it must make a Wisdom saving throw against your wizard spell save DC. On a failed save, or if the creature is willing, it experiences one spell of your choice that affected it within the past day. The spell must have been cast by you or a creature that is friendly to you, and you must have seen the creature be affected by the spell in order to choose it. The creature then magically remembers what it experienced under the effects of that spell, and it begins to experience spell's effects as if it had just been cast on them again. A spell with a duration longer than 1 round lasts until the end of the creature's next turn.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Thought Impression
entries: At 10th level, your memories and thoughts have become firmly lodged in your mind, and your mind has strengthened even further. You can no longer forget any event, conversation, emotion, or experience that you witness, and any experiences that you had forgotten come back to you, and you can remember them with perfect clarity. The events, conversations, emotions, or experiences must have been witnessed after obtaining this feature. As well, they must be witnessed in-person, and not witnessed through a story or form of literature.

subclassFeature.name: Esoteric Reminiscence
entries: At 10th level, you can recall a particular spell that you had seen cast before and cast it as if you know it. Choose one spell that you had seen cast before. You then begin casting the spell using the same action or time of the spell's casting time, such as an action, bonus action, or one minute. The spell must be of a level that you can cast, though the spell does not have to be on the wizard's spell list for you to cast it. You can then cast the spell without material components or expending a spell slot, though all other parameters of the spell remain, such as making an attack roll or forcing a creature to make a saving throw.
Once you have used this feature, you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: School of Transmutation
entries: As a Transmutation Wizard, you gain the following features:

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Schools
entries: You gain the following features for your favored and clashing magic schools.

entries.name: Favored School
entries: You have a talent for reading the glyphs and symbols of {@i Transmutation} magic. The gold and time you must spend to write a divination spell into your spellbook is halved.

entries.name: Clashing School
entries: You find it more difficult to make sense of the sigils and writing structure of {@i Illusion} magic. The gold and time you must spend to write a spell into your spellbook is doubled.

subclassFeature.name: Minor Alchemy
entries: Starting at 1st level when you select this school, you can temporarily alter the physical properties of one nonmagical object, changing it from one substance into another. You perform a special alchemical procedure on one object composed entirely of wood, stone (but not a gemstone), iron, copper, or silver, transforming it into a different one of those materials. For each 10 minutes you spend performing the procedure, you can transform up to 1 cubic foot of material. After 1 hour, or until you lose your concentration (as if you were concentrating on a spell), the material reverts to its original substance.

subclassFeature.name: Transmuter's Stone
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can spend 8 hours creating a transmuter's stone that stores transmutation magic. You can benefit from the stone yourself or give it to another creature. A creature gains a benefit of your choice as long as the stone is in the creature's possession. When you create the stone, choose the benefit from the following options:

items: Darkvision out to a range of 60 feet.
An increase to speed of 10 feet while the creature is unencumbered.
Proficiency in Constitution saving throws.
Resistance to acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage (your choice whenever you choose this benefit).

entries: Each time you cast a transmutation spell of 1st level or higher, you can change the effect of your stone if the stone is on your person.
If you create a new transmuter's stone, the previous one ceases to function.

subclassFeature.name: Shapechanger
entries: At 6th level, you add the {@spell polymorph} spell to your spellbook, if it is not there already. You can cast {@spell polymorph} without expending a spell slot. When you do so, you can target only yourself and transform into a beast whose challenge rating is 1 or lower.
Once you cast polymorph in this way, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest, though you can still cast it normally using an available spell slot.

subclassFeature.name: Master Transmuter
